StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveSchoolEnrollment]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @EnrollmentId uniqueiden..er, @Educa.onId uniqueiden..er, @SchoolId uniqueiden..er, @Degree bit, @EdStartDate date.me, @EdEndDate date.me, @GPA .oat, @GradDate date.me, @GradStatus varchar(10), @Major varchar(15), @EmailAtSchool varchar(50) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT EnrollmentId FROM [ACP].SchoolEnrollment WHERE [EnrollmentId] = @EnrollmentId) BEGIN UPDATE [ACP].[SchoolEnrollment] SET [Educa.onId] = @Educa.onId, [SchoolId] = @SchoolId, [Degree] = @Degree, [EdStartDate] = @EdStartDate, [EdEndDate] = @EdEndDate, [GPA] = @GPA, [GradDate] = @GradDate, [GradStatus] = @GradStatus, [Major] = @Major, [EmailAtSchool] = @EmailAtSchool WHERE [EnrollmentId] = @EnrollmentId END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [ACP].[SchoolEnrollment] ( [EnrollmentId], [Educa.onId], [SchoolId], [Degree], [EdStartDate], [EdEndDate], [GPA], [GradDate], [GradStatus], [Major], [EmailAtSchool] ) VALUES ( @EnrollmentId, @Educa.onId, @SchoolId, @Degree, @EdStartDate, @EdEndDate, @GPA, @GradDate, @GradStatus, @Major, @EmailAtSchool )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
